newsitem.title: NORWAY: Norwegian stocks down in thin trade.
newsitem.headline: Norwegian stocks down in thin trade.

text.p: Norwegian shares fell in step with major European stock exchanges in lacklustre trade on Wednesday.
Oslo's Total share index closed 0.72 percent lower at 1,165.11 points in turnover of 643 million crowns. It was the third drop in as many days this week.
A broker said overseas developments helped depress the market which also was concerned about the volatile crown and falling oil prices.
Fokus Bank plunged 13 percent to 60 crowns after Sparebankgruppen, a group of 16 savings banks, announced it was withdrawing its 73 crowns per share takeover bid for Norway's fourth largest bank.
Industrial conglomerate Norsk Hydro rose 0.66 percent to 383 crowns, but Anglo-Norwegian construction and engineering group Kvaerner fell 1.2 percent to 415 crowns.
Other losers included forestry group Norske Skog and pharmaceutical group Nycomed.
